repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Communications Workers of America, District 2 Arbitration Cases
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact special.collections@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to research visit.
did.abstract: Communications Workers of America, District 2 is responsible for servicing all CWA locals in Pennsylvania, Maryland, Virginia, West Virginia, and Washington DC. The collection mostly contains grievances and arbitration cases.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Communications Workers of America, District 2 is responsible for servicing all CWA locals in Pennsylvania, Maryland, Virginia, West Virginia, and Washington DC. The district represents workers in telecommunications, airlines, broadcast and cable television, health care, public service, printing and news media, food service, higher education and law enforcement. The district was ran by Vice President Peter G. Catucci from 1986-2008. In 2011, District 2 merged with District 13 and Edward Mooney was elected Vice President.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection mostly contains grievances and arbitration cases with telecommunication companies, including C&P Telephone and AT&T, settled by the district. The collection also includes agreements, as well as the district's website from 2009 onwards.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Communications Workers of America, District 2 Arbitration Cases; WAG 218; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

To cite the archived website in this collection: Identification of item, date; Collection Name; Communications Workers of America, District 2 Arbitration Cases; WAG 218; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Arbitration and grievance files are closed. These files appear in boxes 1-12, 26-30, 38-40, 42-45, 47, 49-55, 57, 58, 60-62, and 64.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by the Communications Workers of America, District 2, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: A more detailed inventory is available in the repository.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In 2014, the archived websites were added as a series. Additional websites were added in 2021. The original finding aid was reformatted from a Word document to EAD in 2014.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: http://district2.cwa-union.org/ was initially selected by curators and captured through the use of The California Digital Library's Web Archiving Service in 2009 as part of the Labor Unions and Organizations (U.S.) Web Archive. In 2011, the website redirected to https://district2-13.cwa-union.org/. In 2015, this website was migrated to Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. In 2021, the website redirected to https://cwad2-13.org/ and was added to the web archives. The accession number associated with this URL is 2021.061.
Donated by the Communications Workers of America, District 2, in 1994. The accession number associated with this gift is 1994.022.

appraisal.head: Take Down Policy
appraisal.p: Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: District 2-13 is responsible for servicing all CWA locals in Pennsylvania, Maryland, Delaware, Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia. Members are employed in many different sectors of the economy including, telecommunications; health care; higher education; manufacturing; broadcast and cable television; commercial printing and newspapers; state, local, and country government. Capture of the website began in 2009 at http://district2.cwa-union.org/. News listings on the website date back to 2004, focusing on bargaining, strike votes, voice over internet protocol (VOIP), cable, Verizon, AT&T, T-Mobile, conferences, workplace injuries, and political action campaigns. In late 2010, the website redesigned. It contains district and national CWA news, photographs, bargaining with Mobility and AT&T, CWA-COPE (the political action committee) information, and event listings. At the 2011 CWA convention, Districts 2 and 13 merged and the website reflects that change. From 2011-2016, the website spotlighted action campaigns related to the 2011 Verizon strike, petition, and picket line; the sale and merger of T-Mobile USA to AT&T; the Piedmont Agents local union; Call Center Worker and Consumer Protection Bill; opposition to the Trans-Pacific Partnership; scholarships, and bargaining with SuperMedia LLC, Verizon, AT&T, USAir, LifePath, Inc., Consolidated Communications, Inc., American Red Cross, Frontier Communications, Atlantic Broadband, Windstream, Duquesne Club, Comcast, DE State 9-1-1 and Civilian Employees, Verizon Select Services, United States Infrastructure, AT&T Mobility, Verizon TeleProducts, INOVA, Delaware State 922 and Civilian Employees, the Greenbrier CSX Hotels, United Planning Organization, Share Group, PIW, American Airlines, ITS, Catholic Charities of Washington, DC, and Dex Media. In 2017, the layout of the website was changed, with additional bargaining updates from Altice, MX1, Nokia, DirecTV, and Thryv. The website also focused on Pennsylvania get out the vote and endorsements. In 2020, the website focused on resources for membership on the COVID-19 pandemic and anti-racism work.

In 2021, the Communications Workers of America, District 2-13 redesigned their website and started using an new URL. CWA District 2-13 provides services for CWA locals in Pennsylvania, Maryland, Delaware, Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia. The websites contains union political endorsements, bargaining reports at their workplaces (Altice, American Airlines, American Red Cross, AT&T, AT&T Mobility, Atlantic Broadband, AVAYA, Community College of Baltimore, CCI, Century Link, Comcast, Delaware State Employees, Duquesne Club, Frontier, ITS, LifePath, Nokia, Piedmont Airlines, PIW, Printing, Publishing, and Media Workers, Thryv, Verizon and Windstream), scholarships, broadband access, and other news from the union.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: New site crawls are accrued monthly.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Crawl was limited to domains and subdomains of cwad2-13.org in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints.
